@MsBeeton I was all confused until I realised that they changed the century 16 years ago. I don't know any of this century's music.
@irihapeta Love this!
@BR3NDA @labocalocanz The doughnuts were good. Your problem may have been looking for actual food at Armageddon.
@clementine_ford "20 minutes of action". The mind boggles. (I'll bet the dad will never stop regretting that Freudian phrase.)
@nickhide @Richard_Schiff @WestWingWeekly Totally agree. And had me in tears in places. Loving the podcast (and just rewatched series too.)
Joined the 21st century w my first ever binge watch: The West Wing, which I finally finished, 10 years late. Bring back Bartlett! (Please!)
@Robin1226 You show remarkable naïveté as to how parenting works in the real world.
@AllisonBJanney The rest of the world would be grateful too!
Why not channel outrage over #harambe into boycott of palm oil items that destroy gorilla habitat: ~1/2 of packaged products in food shops.
@Robin1226 That's right. It is a rare event. Most parents have scary near misses once in a while but get lucky. Also some kids are FAST.
@Robin1226 Or we could, as a society, accept that accidents happen and not seek a scapegoat for everything.
@Robin1226 Accountable, how? Killing the child seems a bit harsh. Kids sometimes escape; that's the nature of parenting. For everyone.
I'm sad about the Cincinnati gorilla, but honestly, would people really prefer the child had died? Priorities people. #harambe
@BrandonEvrs The apes are NOT drugged, so the choice was the ape's life or the child's. Hard to see any other call being made.
@BrandonEvrs The public demands that we have open environments and not be behind walls or cages. This is the result.
@irihapeta Endnote? Such a time saver.
@msjuju8 Me too, start to finish. May take some time yet.
@msjuju8 Just this second finished S6E14. Almost there. So refreshing to see principled politicians.
@TrevorMallard @HuttCityCouncil @huttnews @HuttHub That was my fear. Ended up in SV as I'd hoped, but with no signage it was quite unnerving
@TrevorMallard @HuttCityCouncil @huttnews @HuttHub And trails either have no labels at top or incorrect ones (eg "no exit" on polytech path)
@TrevorMallard @HuttCityCouncil @huttnews @HuttHub I'm getting an idea after a year+ of trying many out, but many dead ends, and few maps
@TrevorMallard I took my border collie from Wainui Rd up ECNZ track yesterday to Stokes Valley, but it's always a guess where tracks go.
@TrevorMallard Gorgeous day for it. My dog prefers tracks where she can be off leash though. Would love comprehensive list of local tracks.
@evilrooster I had that dress only pale blue and cap sleeves. It was great. I was also 15kg slimmer.
@Becs Just threw out dozens of them. What in the world were we thinking?
@clarecurranmp To objectify and demean women, and perpetuate the idea that we only have value if we are selected by a man. Duh.
The fact that no NZ media can/will report concerns with proposed NZME/Fairfax merger is a perfect example of the problem with the merger.
@juliefairey Responding to criticism by attacking someone else (whom I hadn't mentioned) is hardly appropriate.
@juliefairey I was speaking about your personal approach to ceremonies, Julie, not talking about someone else. The policy is petty.
@juliefairey I'm Lower Hutt.
@juliefairey It's about priorities. Others make it work. As I said, it meant a lot to me to have them there; glad no petty politics for us
@juliefairey What a petty policy. I was delighted to have list MPs at my ceremony and am glad small-minded politicians didn't ban them.

@hollyrwalker Same here. When I switched apps I deleted the whole backlog and felt free. Still subscribed to far too many.
@hollyrwalker It's insidious. I remember having 5Gb of podcasts waiting, and stressing out that I was falling farther behind every day.
